results.title: Sam Weller and his father
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Shows Sam Weller and his father collaborating on a plan to get Mr Pickwick out of the debtor’s prions and finally managing to give the detestable Mr Stiggins, a lay preacher, a sharp lesson. From the series “Tales from Dickens.”

results.title: The Old soldier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
An excerpt from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. A crisis in the lives of Dr Strong and his young wife Annie is brought about by the selfishness and thoughtless interference of Annie’s mother, “the old soldier”, and the malicious manoeuvrings of Uriah Heep. How this misunderstanding develops and how it is cleared up with David Copperfield’s help is told.

results.title: David and his mother (from David Copperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. Describes the early years of David Copperfield from his life with his widowed mother and servant Peggotty, through his adjustment to his mother’s marriage to Mr Murdstone, until the time of his mother’s death and his enrolment at boarding school.

results.title: David and Dora (from David Copperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. David’s courtship of Dora is marked by great tenderness, amusing misunderstandings and treachery by Miss murdstone, who has re-appeared as Dora’s maid. Due to his aunt’s financial distress, it looks as though David will never marry Dora. But fate intervenes, and when Dora’s father dies leaving her penniless, David and Dora are free to marry.

group_works.title: Three little pigs
group_works.creator_credit: Tim Fox, Ursula Kolbe and Classroom Video

results.title: Three little pigs
results.creator_credit: Tim Fox, Ursula Kolbe and Classroom Video
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from around the world”.
An interpretation of the traditional tale of the Big Bad Wolf and the Three Little Pigs. Uses a combination of hand puppets, simple props and dramatic storytelling to provide a wealth of ideas that could easily be reproduced for use in the classroom. Accompanied by Teacher’s Notes.

results.title: The Rug maker
results.creator_credit: Steven Clark, Nick Bosustow and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales for the Very Young”.
An animated East African folktale with a difference that shows that everyone can benefit from learning a trade. Adapted from the book “When the stones were soft” by Eleanor B. Heady.

results.title: Cold chips
results.creator_credit: Laurens Postma, Udi Eichler and Thames Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Take Six”.
A creative collaboration between Laurens C. Postma and gifted actor and one-man show performer Tim Thomas, this light-hearted entertainment is the story of a possible person in the not too distant silicone/micro-processor future. It is a future that gratifies every conceivable wish but fails to meet the basic need for human contact.
